(a) 60 percent
of the project cost, or when such rehabilitation project does not involve an
acquisition component, 100 percent of the project cost; or
(b) the following per dwelling unit
limitations: (1)
$50,000 for projects except
as provided hereinafter; or
(2)
$75,000 for a high cost project or a project which will receive a loan from the

Federal Farmers Home Administration. No more than 50 percent of the appropriated funds shall be
allocated to homes within a single municipality in any fiscal year. A project
may be deemed to be a high cost project if the project is located within a high
cost area, or it is demonstrated to the satisfaction of the corporation that
the additional subsidy of as much as $25,000 per dwelling unit available to
high cost projects would make housing in such project affordable to households
with incomes at or below 80 percent of the applicable area median
income. Notes
